intro: Gamochaeta ramosa, commonly known as the hairy stemless cudweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has slender, often hairy stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are usually opposite and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
